intro: Aglaia llanosiana, commonly known as the Llanos Aglaia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in regions of Colombia and Venezuela. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, fragrant yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. Aglaia llanosiana is often found in wetland and riparian habitats, thriving in moist, tropical environments.
